Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: W.B. Jones is renovating their offices and their construction crews are taking up some of the parking spaces we used to get.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So we had to park at a satellite parking lot over there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Which just means we get to see more of our lovely street. Tell them what we saw today Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh today, we saw a junk yard dog attacking the bones of a rotisserie chicken.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nature.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Been here nine years. Now all of a sudden I'm supposed to park half a mile away.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I lost a penny out of my loafers, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [sitting down, rubbing his feet] I will quit. As God as my witness, I will quit if this is not fixed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Some of us like the walk more than others.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [off screen] Hurts like hell.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Michael who is looking at a chair catalog] Did you pick a new chair? It's been awhile.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, when I first opened this catalog, I thought I was just going to be picking out a chair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But instead, you found something to distract you from ever picking out a chair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael started the process of selecting a new chair about three weeks ago. And normally I wouldn't care, but he promised me his old one. It's way better. It's one of these. [makes a shrrhhh sound of a chair moving downward as Pam slumps down] I really want it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding up the catalog] Have you ever seen this woman?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The one in the really great mesh black high-back swivel chair?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at her smile. Those eyes, look at her eyes. She's got - I don't know what it is actually, she dresses like a professional and yet you know there is a side of her that could just curl up on a couch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or in a great chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, maybe, but remember after my dinner party when I said that I was swearing off women?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I definitely remember your dinner party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think what I meant was that I was completely swearing off one woman. [whispers] Jan. I think that fate put this catalog in my hands.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Actually, I put the catalog in your hands 'cause you have to pick out a new chair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is it like being single? I like it. I like starting each day with a sense of possibility. And I'm optimistic because every day I get a little more desperate and desperate situations yield the quickest results.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentleman, would you please open your supply catalogs and kindly turn to page 85. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yo, is this his new chair?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] No, he hasn't picked one yet.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [on phone] Daat!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: When Pam gets Michael's old chair, I get Pam's old chair. Then I'll have two chairs. Only one to go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am ready to start dating again. Getting back on the market. So, FYI, for those of you who are thinking about fixing me up with any of your friends, use the woman on page 85 as a template. That will be all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I left my cell phone in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Call us when you get there so we know you're OK. [Andy gets up and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Listen man, I am completely over Jan, so, would you set me up?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: If I had someone to set you up with Michael, then I'd take her for myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought that you were engaged?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nope. Stacy broke up with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whaaaat? God, that's terrible man. Eghh, she's crazy. Umm, are you still on good terms with any of her friends?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Not anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's a bitter situation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... ugh. She's... [gets up and leaves] you don't deserve her. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sitting on Oscar's desk] Oh hello Oscar Mayer Weiner lover. I bet that you have a bunch of very liberal girl type friends that trust you implicitly because they know you'd never touch 'em, because of your condition. Umm...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have a friend who's single.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sandy. She's gorgeous and she's got a feisty personality, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm, I see, feisty. So she's not jolly or sassy? Not like a jolly, sassy opera singer?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Umm, no, she's a professional softball player.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooo. Catcher or in field?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Umm I don't know Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is she a dress wearer or a pants wearer? Could we share a row boat? Could, could a row boat support her?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are you asking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I'm being very clear what I'm asking. Would an average size row boat support her without capsizing? [silence] It bothers me that you're not answering the question.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, alright no, she can't fit in a row boat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it, I knew it! I knew it Phyllis! OK!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is wrong with these people? I would do anything for them and they're just hanging me out to dry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dating shouldn't be hard for somebody like me, but it is and you know why? Because nobody here is willing to help me. Nothing would ever get done in this office without a formal request, would it? Well, fine. Here goes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't think that this is--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, now OK, I know that this is probably not appropriate, but I need help. Because I want to play ball with my kids before I get too old. And before that happens I need to get laid. And before that happens I need to be in love. And I don't wanna hear "Ahnnn... I can't help elhh la la." No. No. I'm a catch and I am not going to be the one who got away. So, this is what we're going to do. Dwight is going to hand out index cards and I want you all to write down the name of an eligible woman for me to date by the end of the day. No, by the end of the hour or you are fired.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [gets up from chair] Write legibly people.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Because of the construction at W.B. Jones, half of us have to park in the satellite lot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's like a ten minute walk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, thirty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, look, I am in an assigned parking place in front, so... Alright, alright, alright, umm let me try to think about what it would be like to not have one. [thinks] OK, yes that would be bad.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That would be bad.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...So help us out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wish I could, but I can't. Well can, but won't. Should, maybe, but shorn't.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, please he-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What part of shorn't don't you understand, Kevin? Look I could probably handle it, yes, but I think it would be a good exercise for you guys to do it yourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We won't let you down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh you can't because I don't care. Listen, [Kevin and Andy high five as they leave Michael's office] don't forget to fill out those cards. My love cards.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: There's nobody I hate enough to write her name on this card.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, I'm setting Michael up with my fat friend anyway, he can just deal with it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Who are you putting down?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you don't know her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, whatever. [Jim holds up the card] [Pam laughs] Give it to me. Give it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Wendy. Hot and juicy red head. Give this a try. [Michael dials phone number. Phone rings.]

Quote.Speaker: Wendy's phone operator
Quote.Text: Wendy's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello Wendy, this is Kevin's friend, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Wendy's phone operator
Quote.Text: This isn't Wendy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry, could you put her on please?

Quote.Speaker: Wendy's phone operator
Quote.Text: Dude, this is a Wendy's restaurant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under breath] Damn it Kevin. OK, umm, could I just have a frosty and a baked potato please?

Quote.Speaker: Wendy's phone operator
Quote.Text: You have to come to the restaurant to order food.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'll send somebody to come pick it up. Just have it ready.

Quote.Speaker: Wendy's phone operator
Quote.Text: It's ready now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well put it aside. [hangs up the phone] [Dwight enters] Umm... yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, I have collected the rest of the ladies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Good because this batch was awful. Umm... this one says chair model...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wrote that. Michael, you shouldn't have to settle. This is my pledge to you. I will find her and I will bring her to you and as God as my witness, she shall bear your fruit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That sounds good. [both smile] Go get her. Wa-Wait, wait, wait, wait. First, go to Wendy's, get my food. Come back and then go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] That is fantastic. Thank you, thank you very much. This is just what I needed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The furniture company gave me the name of the advertising agency. They gave me the name of the photographer. The photographer, a Spaniard, used a Wilkes-Barre modeling agency. The agency gave me the following information. [reads from notepad] Deborah Shoshlefski. 142 South Windsor Lane. Dead. Car accident. Case closed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's dead? [Dwight makes knife slitting noise] She's so young.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She was so young and now she is dead. As dead as every dead animal who has ever died.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God. Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you sit down? Michael... come on. [gets up and leads Michael to sit in his chair] Here we go. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, you didn't even know her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Try not to be so hurtful Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, how dare you. [Jim's face is in shock]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please, not at a time like this. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK Michael, you know what? I might have someone for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh really? What's her name? Burger King?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean it. [walks towards Michael] She's really nice and sweet and you guys might actually get along. [hands over card to Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't, I don't think I'm ready. Is she hot?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm setting Michael up with my land lady. She's really sweet and... whatever, I just can't take Michael like this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No question about it, I am ready to get hurt again.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We need to assemble the five families.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [while brushing teeth with an electric toothbrush] No, not the five families.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We have to.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The five families are the five companies of Scranton Business Park. The bosses rarely meet. There's Michael Scott, Regional Manager, Dunder Mifflin. Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration. Paul Faust of Disaster Kits Limited. They call him "Cool Guy Paul." W.B. Jones of W.B. Jones Heating and Air. Grade A Bad Ass. And Bill Cress of Cress Tool and Dye. Bill Cress is super old and really mean.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still brushing teeth] Sorry, I don't have time for this right now. I'm trying to get a date with Pam's hot friend. And she needs to meet me right now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Andy] I'm calling the meeting anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to cashier at coffee shop] Thank you very much. Our suspect has straight brown hair. She is wearing blue jeans and a black top. So... behold our bachelorette [cut to a blonde woman in a skirt]. Give her ten for looks and a three for her ability to describe herself. Hello, my lady. [woman walks right by and doesn't respond]

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [turns around to see the woman from his description] Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: Are you Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is who a Michael what?

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry, I'm, I'm supposed to be meeting someone named Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that's not, yeah I'm not... OK...

Quote.Speaker: Coffee shop worker
Quote.Text: Michael? Michael? [reads cup] Large hot chocolate with caramel and a shot of peppermint.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you get the rent checks every month and what happens next? What...

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: You're asking what I do with the checks that people write to me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just making conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why is it so hard to meet people? I... you know... it's uh... All I want is somebody nice and sweet and someone I can talk to and share an experience with, you know? Why is it so hard for people like us?

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You wanna see what I walked out on? This is gonna blow your mind. [holds up cell phone with a picture of Jan] Look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: She's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, and you can't see her whole body. Down here, she's got a boob job. Just... she was just crazy smart and really manipulative and I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Michael? Hello? Michael? [Michael hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: I'm gonna head out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. Well, umm... I enjoyed this conversation. It was very nice. It was like talking to the sweet old lady on the bus.

Quote.Speaker: Margaret
Quote.Text: That's incredibly rude.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now you ruined it. [gets up and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Where's Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh Michael Scott could not make it today due to an unforeseen prior engagement.

Quote.Speaker: W.B. Jones
Quote.Text: Let's just meet back in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gentleman please. We called this meeting. Andrew Bernard is the name of me. And this is my associate, Mr. Kevin Malone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [nervously stuttering] I... have... things...

Quote.Speaker: W.B. Jones
Quote.Text: Alright, what do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well first of all, I'd just like to say [pulls out note cards] what an honor it is to be sitting here with you gentlemen.

Quote.Speaker: W.B. Jones
Quote.Text: You have about ten seconds--

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We want our parking spaces back!

Quote.Speaker: Paul Faust
Quote.Text: Whose parking spaces?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: W.B. Jones' construction guys park in our parking spaces every morning and some people have to park really far away and walk all the way to the office. And some people sweat too much for comfort and--

Quote.Speaker: Bill Cress
Quote.Text: Ohh... God...

Quote.Speaker: Paul
Quote.Text: I don't have time for this you guys. [to W.B. Jones] Just give 'em back their spaces.

Quote.Speaker: W.B. Jones
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Paul
Quote.Text: We good? OK. Could have done this over e-mail.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: After Stacy left, things did not go well for awhile. And, and it was hard to see... [starts breaking up] It's just nice to win one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Margaret the land lady? Really Pam, is that what you think of me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's sweet and cute. I thought you'd get along.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK, Well I'm looking for a passionate affair, not companionship. I'm a man... of intensity, of, of cool and youth and, and passionately. God...[walks away back to his office]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walks up to reception] Margaret?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You just got yourself kicked out of your apartment. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh I don't care, I didn't really like that place that much anyway. I'll just move.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh really? Who's gonna take you in? You're messy. You're a klutz, you spill everything. And you leave the volume on the TV way too loud.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, maybe I'll just move in with my boyfriend 'cause he's kind of a slob, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, sure. Let's do it. [Pam laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I umm, well I'm not gonna, I'm, I'm not gonna move in with anyone unless I'm engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Have I not proposed to you, yet?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm, I don't, know...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, well, that's coming. [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, right now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Not gonna do it right here, that would be rather lame.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, so then, when?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, I'm not gonna tell you. Hate to break it to you, but that's not how that works.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, right, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, I'm serious. It's happening.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohh kay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And when it happens, it's going to kick your ass, Beesly. So... stay sharp.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've been warned.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am not kidding. [shows camera an engagement ring] Got it a week after we started dating.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know man. I was with Jan for so long. I was excited about meeting somebody new. Put my heart out there. It's just... [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what you need? Closure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right. What do you mean though?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There was a woman in your life who affected you very deeply, and she left before you could say good bye. I think you need to say good bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. I'll drive.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We did it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [at same time as Kevin] I did it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We got our spaces back.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow. [Stanley laughs and high fives Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. [fist bumps Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, there it is. You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did I do this for me? No, I did this for the little guy. For Joe Sixpack. The guy who wakes up every morning in his four hundred dollar a month apartment, wonders how's he gonna pay his mortgage that month. Wonders how he's gonna fill his car up with oil. Wonders how I'm gonna pay my kid's orphanage bills. That guy shouldn't have to wonder where he's gonna park.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking at the chair model's headstone] How did she die?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I guess you could say she died of blunt force trauma and blood loss. She got in a car accident and plowed into the side of an airplane hanger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She was so innocent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She was stoned apparently.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know I used to think that I had this perfect person out there waiting for me, but knowing that, that's just silly because she's dead. What do you do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wait until next year's chair catalog comes out and you find someone who's still alive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you move on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where do you want to go for dinner?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, I kind of hate all our regular places right now. Oh, you know what [Jim gets down on one knee], that one...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, will you wait for me one second while I tie my shoe?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiling] I hate you. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? My shoe is untied. What is your problem? [Pam laughs] Oh my God, you thought I wa-- oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How could I have thought that? How could I have thought that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Bye, bye, Ms. Chair Model lady. I dreamt that we were married and you treated me nice. We had lots of kids...drinking whiskey and rye, oh why'd you have to go off and die? Why'd you have to go off [with Dwight] and die?

Quote.Speaker: Michael/Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] OH! You believe in rock 'n roll. Can music save your mortal soul? And then [jumbling up the words] can you have to dance real slow. Well, I know that you're in love with him. 'Cause I saw you dancing in the gym. [more jumbled words] 'You both kicked off your shoes. Those rhythm and blues...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Return.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rhythm and blues...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This'll be [with Dwight] the day that I died.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is moving day. I have spent the last month here at Dwight's lovely farm, taking a little bit of a vacation, clearing my head after Jan and I, um [Dwight puts his fingers to his head and makes a shooting noise] ssp... No, I did not kill her. We were just at different places in our lives. No, I thought I'd be the bigger man and allow her to stay at the condo. She has since moved on; she is staying with her sister in Scottsdale. Fresh outlook, and it's all good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, so look that over, make sure it's accurate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your bill, minus the ten percent Dunder Mifflin corporate discount.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You were charging me? I'm your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You occupied the America room for six weeks. That's our most popular room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There was no other guest the entire time I was here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Because you were in the America room. In an election year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. All right, Dwight. Take my money. Go ahead. Keep in mind that this whole thing was just a business transaction. The late nights, the talks, the slumber parties, the crying jags, that was all business, that had nothing to do with friendship, and being friends. Just ring me up. Go ahead [Dwight tears up bill].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We don't take debit cards, anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, little help with the bags, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, what about you, Angela? Do you have any single friends?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A cute little religious type, someone who wears a uniform, or...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: A Catholic schoolgirl?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, obviously older.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: A nun?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Love. Marriage. Baby carriage. Those have been my goals ever since I heard that song. Jan and I had love. We did not have marriage. We did have a baby carriage, which I got her for bringing groceries home, after she got a DUI.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hi, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sitting at her desk] Hey, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing. Just hangin'. Chillin'. No agenda. Would you consider hookin' me up with one of your friends?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, all my friends are crazy. My one friend, Brianna...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, my God...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's hilarious. What's her number?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She's 23.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm... nah, that's too young.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Actually, I know a ton of people that I can set you up with!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Some of my friends' parents, they're getting divorced now. [Michael gets up and starts walking away] So I think some of those, like, older ladies, they're really looking for a guy to go on a date with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ['Rita Klondike 507' is written on an index card] All right, time's up! Pencils down. Please pass your future Mrs. Michael Scotts forward.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Forcing your employees to set you up is not a, uh, uh, technical violation of any Dunder Mifflin rule. You know, but neither is forcing them to help you with a shot-by-shot remake of Indiana Jones. Huh-how do you make a rule book like that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pammy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't have anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't have one single girlfriend?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not looking for a perfect 10 here, just somebody to hang out with. Just fun, healthy young woman.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A kindergarten teacher, who is great with kids, maybe an ex-model, and now she wants to do something with her brain?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I don't, I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How 'bout a professional volleyball player who models on the side?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, just a fun, guh, look, there, here, it doesn't have to be a model. I'm not, don't rule out model, but just in terms of models, there are like twenty different categories. There's face models, hand models, body models [Jim raises hand] - yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I actually know a sex model.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. Yeah. She's blind, is that a problem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I am, it's all about the personality, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you talking about Beverley?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because she's not a sex model. She's a tollbooth operator.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Send me a picture.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So far, these are my leads. A blind tollbooth operator and a twelve hundred pound catcher. It's a start.
